final_answer.explanation: In the 1980 NFL season, the New Orleans Saints had a notably poor performance, finishing with a record of just 1 win and 15 losses. This record made them the team with the fewest wins that season. To determine the college associated with this team, we can look at notable players from the Saints' roster during that season. One of the players was Mike Augustyniak, who played college football at Purdue University. Other players included Adger Armstrong, who played at Texas A&M University, and Donovan Rose, who played at Hampton University. Therefore, the colleges associated with the New Orleans Saints, the team that won only one game in the 1980 season, include Purdue University, Texas A&M University, and Hampton University.
final_answer.answer: Purdue University, Texas A&M University, Hampton University
